event.title: 1522, through the Portuguese, the first ships from Europe arrived

data.event: In 1522, through the Portuguese, the first ships from Europe arrived, and by 1866 Sumba belonged to the Dutch East Indies, although the island did not come under real Dutch administration until the twentieth century.

In 1522, through the Portuguese, the first ships from Europe arrived, and by 1866 Sumba belonged to the Dutch East Indies, although the island did not come under real Dutch administration until the twentieth century.

event.title: opened a mission in Laura, West Sumba in 1866

data.event: Jesuits opened a mission in Laura, West Sumba in 1866.
